intro: Didymocarpus demissus, commonly known as the slender mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, though they may change color depending on the variety. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The botanical features of Didymocarpus demissus make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
